com.brightcove.mobile.android
Class BCPlayerView

java.lang.Object
  RelativeLayout
      com.brightcove.mobile.android.BCPlayerView
All Implemented Interfaces:
BCPlayerControls.MediaPlayerControl
public class BCPlayerView
extends RelativeLayout
implements BCPlayerControls.MediaPlayerControl

Displays a video file. The VideoView class can load images from various sources (such as resources or content providers), takes care of computing its measurement from the video so that it can be used in any layout manager, and provides various display options such as scaling and tinting.

onSizeChanged

protected void onSizeChanged(int pW,
                             int pH,

Automatically detects size changes (mostly orientation changes) and reloads the player in the proper position.

initControls

protected void initControls()
Creates initial view state for player controls. BCPlayerControls

rotateOrientation

public void rotateOrientation()

load

public void load(Video pVideo)
Loads the given Video for playback. Playback does not start until start() is called.

Parameters:
pVideo - the Video to play back, which can be retrieved from the Media API SDK. This Video must have at least one valid rendition whose encoding rate is within the range specified by setRenditionBitRateRange() and must use HTTP URLs.

stop

public void stop()
Stops playback and releases any internal media-related resources. This should be called when it is known that playback does not need to start again for the current Video.

validateHTTPURL

protected java.lang.Boolean validateHTTPURL(java.lang.String pUrl)
Ensures that the given URL is a valid HTTP URL suitable for playback on Android.

Parameters:
pUrl - the URL to be verified
Returns:
true if the URL appears to be a valid HTTP URL, false otherwise

getURLForVideo

protected java.lang.String getURLForVideo(Video pVideo)
Selects the rendition with the highest bit rate that falls within the configured bit rate range. If no rendition can be found in the specified range, the FLVURL property will be used. If the FLVURL property is not present, null will be returned.

Parameters:
pVideo - the Video from which a rendition should be selected
Returns:
the URL from the rendition with the highest bit rate that is within the configured range, the FLVURL if none are found, or null if all of the above fails to retrieve a URL

resetBitRateRange

public void resetBitRateRange()
Resets the player configuration properties to their default values.
  • Sets the low and high bit rates to DEFAULT_LOW_BITRATE and DEFAULT_HIGH_BITRATE

setRenditionBitRateRange

public void setRenditionBitRateRange(java.lang.Integer pLow,
                                     java.lang.Integer pHigh)
Specify the range of bit rates that should be used when selecting dynamic delivery renditions for playback.

Parameters:
pLow - the lowest bitrate that will be played
pHigh - the highest bitrate that will be played

getLowBitRate

public java.lang.Integer getLowBitRate()
The currently configured low end of the range of bit rates allowed to be used for video playback.

Returns:
the lowest bit rate that will be used for playback

getHighBitRate

public java.lang.Integer getHighBitRate()
The currently configured high end of the range of bit rates allowed to be used for video playback.

Returns:
the highest bit rate that will be used for playback

setOnPreparedListener

protected void setOnPreparedListener(MediaPlayer.OnPreparedListener pListener)
Register a callback to be invoked when the media file is loaded and ready to go.

Parameters:
pListener - The callback that will be run

setOnCompletionListener

protected void setOnCompletionListener(OnCompletionListener pListener)
Register a callback to be invoked when the end of a media file has been reached during playback.

Parameters:
pListener - The callback that will be run

setOnErrorListener

public void setOnErrorListener(OnErrorListener pListener)
Register a callback to be invoked when an error occurs during playback or setup. If no listener is specified, or if the listener returned false, BCPlayerView will inform the user of any errors.

Parameters:
pListener - The callback that will be run

onTouchEvent

public final boolean onTouchEvent(MotionEvent pEvent)
Responsible for showing and hiding player controls on touch events.

Parameters:
pEvent - the MotionEvent that was raised from the user touch action
Returns:
always returns false as other Views might need this event

onTrackballEvent

public final boolean onTrackballEvent(MotionEvent pEvent)
Responsible for displaying the player controls on trackball events.

Parameters:
pEvent - the MotionEvent that was raised from the user touch action
Returns:
always returns false as other Views might need this event

onKeyDown

public final boolean onKeyDown(int pKeyCode,
                               KeyEvent pEvent)
Responsible for providing some basic hardware keyboard support for starting/stopping the player.

Parameters:
pKeyCode - the key code that was raised
pEvent - the KeyEvent that was raised
Returns:
returns true if the event was handled, or delegates to the parent to handle the event
